class.name: Rotor4D
class.brief_description: 4D geometric algebra rotor for smooth rotations in 4D space.
class.description: Rotor4D is a 4D geometric algebra rotor that can be used to represent rotations in 4D space. It is the 4D equivalent of a quaternion, which allows for 3D rotations. Quaternions are isomorphic to 3D rotors, which means that the calculations work out to be the same, but rotors are more general and can represent rotations in any number of dimensions. In geometric algebra terms, a rotor is a multivector that represents a rotation in a subspace. The rotor is a sum of a scalar part and a bivector part. The scalar part represents the cosine of half the rotation angle, and the bivector part represents the sine of half the rotation angle. The bivector part is a sum of the shadows of the rotation in each plane of the subspace. Rotor4D also includes the pseudoscalar part, which is not used for rotations but is required for some calculations such as being closed under multiplication.

method.name: conjugate
method.description: Conjugate flips the sign of the bivector components. For 4D rotors, this is identical to the [method reverse], but both are included for completeness and clarity.

method.name: copy
method.description: Returns a copy of this [Rotor4D] resource. Note that without copying, [Rotor4D] is pass-by-reference, like all Godot objects, and unlike structs such as [Vector4].

method.name: dot
method.description: The dot product of two rotors is the sum of the products of their components. This measures how aligned the rotors are. Rotors pointing in similar directions have a positive dot product, while rotors pointing in opposite directions have a negative dot product.

method.name: dual
method.description: Dual multiplies each component by the unit pseudoscalar (xyzw) from the right. For example, [code]xy * xyzw = xyxyzw = -xxyyzw = -zw[/code], and [code]xz * xyzw = xzxyzw = +xxyzzw = +yw[/code]. This is symmetric front to back, [code]result[i][/code] is set to [code]+/- elements[15 - i][/code].

method.name: from_array
method.description: Creates a [Rotor4D] from a [PackedFloat32Array] or [PackedFloat64Array]. The array may be of any length, but only the first 8 elements will be used.

method.name: from_bivector_magnitude
method.description: Constructs a rotor that represents a rotation where the angle is the magnitude of the given bivector, and the planes of rotation are the normalized bivector. This is the inverse of [method get_rotation_bivector_magnitude].

method.name: from_bivector_normal_angle
method.description: Constructs a rotor that represents a rotation where the angle is the given angle, and the planes of rotation are the bivector. The given bivector must be normalized. This is the inverse of [method get_rotation_bivector_normal] and [method get_rotation_angle].

method.name: from_numbers
method.description: Creates a [Rotor4D] from 8 numbers representing the scalar (s), bivector (xy, xz, xw, yz, yw, zw), and pseudoscalar (xyzw) components.

method.name: from_vectors
method.description: Constructs a rotor stored in two [Vector4]s. Note that this is NOT the same as the geometric product of two vectors. The first [Vector4] stores the scalar, xy, xz, and xw components, and the second [Vector4] stores the yz, yw, zw, and xyzw components.

method.name: from_wy
method.description: Create a rotor representing a rotation in the wy plane by the given angle. This is the negative of [method rotation_yw].

method.name: from_xw
method.description: Create a rotor representing a rotation in the xw plane by the given angle.

method.name: from_xy
method.description: Create a rotor representing a rotation in the xy plane by the given angle.

method.name: from_xz
method.description: Create a rotor representing a rotation in the xz plane by the given angle. This is the negative of [method rotation_zx].

method.name: from_yw
method.description: Create a rotor representing a rotation in the yw plane by the given angle. This is the negative of [method rotation_wy].

method.name: from_yz
method.description: Create a rotor representing a rotation in the yz plane by the given angle.

method.name: from_zw
method.description: Create a rotor representing a rotation in the zw plane by the given angle.

method.name: from_zx
method.description: Create a rotor representing a rotation in the zx plane by the given angle. This is the negative of [method rotation_xz].

method.name: get_rotation_angle
method.description: Returns the angle of the rotation represented by the rotor. This function, and [method get_rotation_bivector_normal], are the inverse of [method rotation_bivector_normal_angle].

method.name: get_rotation_basis
method.description: Converts the rotor to a Basis4D pure rotation matrix. This is equivalent to rotating the identity basis by the rotor, but faster. In GDScript, the basis is bound as a [Projection] for use in Variant.

method.name: get_rotation_bivector_magnitude
method.description: Returns the bivector representing the rotation planes of the rotor, where the magnitude of the bivector is the angle of the rotation. This function is the inverse of [method rotation_bivector_magnitude].

method.name: get_rotation_bivector_normal
method.description: Returns the normalized bivector representing the rotation planes of the rotor. This function, and [method get_rotation_angle], are the inverse of [method rotation_bivector_normal_angle].

method.name: identity
method.description: Returns the identity 4D rotor, which has the scalar part 1 and all other parts 0.

method.name: inner_product
method.description: The full geometric algebra inner product with all components. See scalar_product if you only want the scalar part. This represents a projection and then a contraction. It is bilinear, not symmetric, and may be negative. The inner product two basis rotors is their geometric product if they share all factors.

method.name: inverse
method.description: The inverse of a rotor is the rotor that, when multiplied with the original rotor, results in the identity rotor.

method.name: involute
method.description: Grade involution flips the sign of odd-numbered grades. This is a no-op for 4D rotors. It is included for completeness and clarity.

method.name: is_normalized
method.description: Returns true if the rotor is normalized, meaning it has a length of 1.0. Only normalized rotors represent valid pure rotations.

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the length of the rotor. This is the square root of the sum of the squares of all components.

method.name: length_squared
method.description: Returns the squared length of the rotor. This is useful for comparing rotor lengths without the need for an expensive square root operation.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns a normalized copy of the rotor. The normalized rotor has a length of 1.0, and is computed by dividing each component by the length of the rotor. Only normalized rotors represent valid pure rotations.

method.name: regressive_product
method.description: The regressive product is the dual of the wedge/exterior/outer product. It represents the largest subspace contained by the input rotors, so long as the duals of the inputs are linearly independent.

method.name: reverse
method.description: The reverse function flips the sign of the bivector components. For 4D rotors, this is identical to the [method conjugate], but both are included for completeness and clarity.

method.name: rotate_basis
method.description: Rotates a basis by this rotor. This is equivalent to rotating each vector in the basis by the rotor.

method.name: rotate_vector
method.description: Rotates a vector by this rotor.

method.name: sandwich
method.description: Multiplies the rotor with the vector, and then multiplies the result with the right rotor, returning only the vector part. This is useful for things like rotation operations. Prefer using [method rotate_vector] and [method rotate_basis] instead, unless you're really hungry and want a sandwich.

method.name: scalar_product
method.description: The scalar part of the geometric algebra inner product only. This is also the scalar part of multiplication.

method.name: slerp
method.description: Spherically interpolates between this rotor and the target rotor by the given weight. The weight should be on the range of 0.0 to 1.0. A weight of 0.0 will result in this rotor, and a weight of 1.0 will result in the target rotor.

method.name: slerp_fraction
method.description: Spherically interpolates between the identity rotor and this rotor by the given weight. The weight should be on the range of 0.0 to 1.0. A weight of 0.0 will result in the identity rotor, and a weight of 1.0 will result in this rotor.

method.name: to_array
method.description: Converts the [Rotor4D] to a [PackedFloat32Array] or [PackedFloat64Array]. The array will have 8 elements.

method.name: vector_product
method.description: The vector product, also known as the geometric vector product or the Holm√©r product, is the full multiplication of two vectors. The geometric vector product combines the dot product (scalar) and the wedge/cross product (bivector). The interpretation of the result is a Rotor4D that, when applied as the sandwich product to a vector, double-rotates the vector by the angle between the two input vectors. Therefore, for rotating by some angle, the input vectors should have an angle between them of half the desired rotation angle.

method.name: wedge_product
method.description: The wedge/exterior/outer product is the dual of the regressive product. It represents the smallest subspace containing the input multivectors. The outer product of two basis multivectors is their geometric product if they share no factors.

method.name: with_s
method.description: Returns a copy of this rotor with the [member s] scalar component replaced by the given value.

method.name: with_xw
method.description: Returns a copy of this rotor with the [member xw] bivector component replaced by the given value.

method.name: with_xy
method.description: Returns a copy of this rotor with the [member xy] bivector component replaced by the given value.

method.name: with_xyzw
method.description: Returns a copy of this rotor with the [member xyzw] pseudoscalar component replaced by the given value.

method.name: with_xz
method.description: Returns a copy of this rotor with the [member xz] bivector component replaced by the given value.

method.name: with_yw
method.description: Returns a copy of this rotor with the [member yw] bivector component replaced by the given value.

method.name: with_yz
method.description: Returns a copy of this rotor with the [member yz] bivector component replaced by the given value.

method.name: with_zw
method.description: Returns a copy of this rotor with the [member zw] bivector component replaced by the given value.

members.member: All of the bivector components packed into an [AABB] for binding to Variant. In total its values represent the sine of half the rotation angle in each plane, where each component is the shadow of the rotation in that plane.
The scalar part of the rotor. This is the real number part of the rotor, and represents the cosine of half the rotation angle.

The bivector XW plane component of the rotor. It represents the shadow in the XW plane of the sine of half the rotation angle. For pure rotations in the XW plane, this is the sine of half the rotation angle.

The bivector XY plane component of the rotor. It represents the shadow in the XY plane of the sine of half the rotation angle. For pure rotations in the XY plane, this is the sine of half the rotation angle.
The pseudoscalar component of the rotor. It is not used to represent rotations, but is required for some calculations.

The bivector XZ plane component of the rotor. It represents the shadow in the XZ plane of the sine of half the rotation angle. For pure rotations in the XZ plane, this is the sine of half the rotation angle.

The bivector YW plane component of the rotor. It represents the shadow in the YW plane of the sine of half the rotation angle. For pure rotations in the YW plane, this is the sine of half the rotation angle.

The bivector YZ plane component of the rotor. It represents the shadow in the YZ plane of the sine of half the rotation angle. For pure rotations in the YZ plane, this is the sine of half the rotation angle.

The bivector ZW plane component of the rotor. It represents the shadow in the ZW plane of the sine of half the rotation angle. For pure rotations in the ZW plane, this is the sine of half the rotation angle.
